review: Basically the same price as a Roku but with more functionality and much faster. You can play a lot of android games from the Amazon Store but you need to buy the controller if you want to use it for games because only a limited selection of games work without the gamepad controller. When browsing the apps and games it shows you which apps need the controller with a little icon, so you don't purchase or download an app that you can't use.
author: Michael S. Urvan

review: I have owned my Fire TV for a little over a month, and I have been very pleased. Until now, I have been a Roku fanboy, but recently have been infuriated by the slow response time, buffering, and connection issues from both of my Roku's. I was planning on purchasing an Apple TV, but was concerned with Apple's limited support for their "hobby" set top box.I have been extremely pleased with the Fire TV. So pleased, that I purchased a second one when it was on sale the other week! I am still getting used to pressing a button on the remote, and the set top box responds instantly (a luxury that I never had with Roku's slow interface and weak processor). Application and show load quickly and I have only had minor instances of buffering (to be expected).The hardware is excellent and the interface is decent. I wish voice search worked within all applications (Netflix & Hulu), rather than just Prime instant. Oh well, not a big deal for me.This set top box is the only logical choice at this time. It's competition can't even come close to the speed it has to offer, which is the most important thing for me.

review: I have tried out many different smart TV adapters and as of right now Fire TV takes the win!  Apple TV... I never thought anything could be better than Apple TV...The UI is clean, neat, and easy to navigate, plus the device just functioned reliably.  Then I decided for the other TV in my house to try something new, so I went for the Sony Google TV...what a mistake, from day one that piece never worked properly.  There were so many glitches in the software that would leave you hanging waiting desperately for something to load, and it wasn't an issue with my ISP because all my other devices were very speedy.  I quickly abandoned the Sony Google TV to maintain my sanity.  After a few months went by I decided to try the Amazon Fire TV...BEST DAY EVER!  This device is lightening fast! Thanks to all the ram, quad core processor and dual band wifi it never leaves you hanging.  Now, when I go back and use my Apple TV, I am astonished with the load times and slowness (albeit it is not a slow device).  Amazon Fire TV loads media in an instant and is just ready to go all the time.  The voice search, at first, seemed a bit gimmicky, it's not!  Super intuitive, accurate, fast, and easy. I use it frequently.  The only negative about this device is application store, which could be better organized.  Thank you Amazon for making, in my opinion, the best Smart TV adapter around.
